article.title: Understanding the DOM
article.author: Jack Taylor
article.content: The DOM is a programming interface for web documents. It represents the page so that programs can change the structure, style, and content dynamically.

article.title: Getting Started with XML
article.author: Jill Taylor
article.content: XML, or Extensible Markup Language, is used to store and transport data. It is both human-readable and machine-readable.

article.title: Why Learn JavaScript?
article.author: Chris Johnson
article.content: JavaScript is essential for creating interactive and dynamic web pages. It enhances the user experience by allowing developers to implement complex features.
